Finding the right subjects: Choosing the right subjects for the documentary is crucial, but it can be challenging to find people who are willing to participate and open up about their experiences.
Access to locations: The documentary filmmaker may face challenges in gaining access to locations or obtaining necessary permits to film in certain locations.
Legal issues: The filmmaker may encounter legal issues related to copyright, intellectual property, and privacy rights when using footage, interviews, and other materials.
Technical difficulties: Filming and editing a documentary can be a technical process, and the filmmaker may encounter issues with equipment, software, or storage of data.
Creative differences: The filmmaker may have creative differences with the subjects or other members of the production team, which can impact the overall direction and quality of the documentary.
